section: Suhi - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ਥਾਕੇ ਨੈਨ ਸ੍ਰਵਨ ਸੁਨਿ ਥਾਕੇ ਥਾਕੀ ਸੁੰਦਰਿ ਕਾਇਆ ॥
section: Suhi - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: My eyes are exhausted, and my ears are tired of hearing; my beautiful body is exhausted.

transliteration.text: thākē nain sravan sun thākē thākī sundar kāiā .

melody.description: Suhi is an expression of such devotion that the listener experiences feelings of extreme closeness and undying love. The listener is bathed in that love and genuinely comes to know what it means to adore.

author.author: Saint Kabir
author.description:
Saint Kabir [1440 - 1518] was a Muslim mystic born in Varanasi in India, whose 541 hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. His writings about God are full of love and devotion, very direct and striking in appeal.

The birth of Kabir remains to this day shrouded in mystery and legend. Authorities disagree on both when he was born and who his parents were. One legend proclaims a divine virginal birth. His mother was reputed to have been of the Brahman caste and to have become pregnant after a visit to a Hindu shrine.

Because she was unwed, she abandoned Kabir, who was found and adopted by a Muslim weaver. That his early life began as a Muslim there is no doubt, although he later became influenced by the Hindu ascetic, Ramananda, who he accepted as his Guru.

text: ਜਰਾ ਹਾਕ ਦੀ ਸਭ ਮਤਿ ਥਾਕੀ ਏਕ ਨ ਥਾਕਸਿ ਮਾਇਆ ॥੧॥
section: Suhi - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Driven forward by old age, all my senses are exhausted; only my attachment to Maya is not exhausted. ||1||

transliteration.text: jarā hāk dī sabh mat thākī ēk n thākas māiā .1.

melody.description: Suhi is an expression of such devotion that the listener experiences feelings of extreme closeness and undying love. The listener is bathed in that love and genuinely comes to know what it means to adore.

author.author: Saint Kabir
author.description:

Because she was unwed, she abandoned Kabir, who was found and adopted by a Muslim weaver. That his early life began as a Muslim there is no doubt, although he later became influenced by the Hindu ascetic, Ramananda, who he accepted as his Guru.

text: ਬਾਵਰੇ ਤੈ ਗਿਆਨ ਬੀਚਾਰੁ ਨ ਪਾਇਆ ॥
section: Suhi - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: O mad man, you have not obtained spiritual wisdom and meditation.

transliteration.text: bāvarē tai giān bīchār n pāiā .

melody.description: Suhi is an expression of such devotion that the listener experiences feelings of extreme closeness and undying love. The listener is bathed in that love and genuinely comes to know what it means to adore.

section: Suhi - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: You have wasted this human life, and lost. ||1||Pause||

melody.description: Suhi is an expression of such devotion that the listener experiences feelings of extreme closeness and undying love. The listener is bathed in that love and genuinely comes to know what it means to adore.

text: ਤਬ ਲਗੁ ਪ੍ਰਾਨੀ ਤਿਸੈ ਸਰੇਵਹੁ ਜਬ ਲਗੁ ਘਟ ਮਹਿ ਸਾਸਾ ॥
section: Suhi - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: O mortal, serve the Lord, as long as the breath of life remains in the body.

transliteration.text: tab lag prānī tisai sarēvah jab lag ghat mah sāsā .

melody.description: Suhi is an expression of such devotion that the listener experiences feelings of extreme closeness and undying love. The listener is bathed in that love and genuinely comes to know what it means to adore.

author.author: Saint Kabir

The birth of Kabir remains to this day shrouded in mystery and legend. Authorities disagree on both when he was born and who his parents were. One legend proclaims a divine virginal birth. text: ਜੇ ਘਟੁ ਜਾਇ ਤ ਭਾਉ ਨ ਜਾਸੀ ਹਰਿ ਕੇ ਚਰਨ ਨਿਵਾਸਾ ॥੨॥
section: Suhi - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: And even when your body dies, your love for the Lord shall not die; you shall dwell at the Feet of the Lord. ||2||

transliteration.text: jē ghat jāi t bhāu n jāsī har kē charan nivāsā .2.

melody.description: Suhi is an expression of such devotion that the listener experiences feelings of extreme closeness and undying love. The listener is bathed in that love and genuinely comes to know what it means to adore.

text: ਜਿਸ ਕਉ ਸਬਦੁ ਬਸਾਵੈ ਅੰਤਰਿ ਚੂਕੈ ਤਿਸਹਿ ਪਿਆਸਾ ॥
section: Suhi - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: When the Word of the Shabad abides deep within, thirst and desire are quenched.

transliteration.text: jis kau sabad basāvai antar chūkai tisah piāsā .

melody.description: Suhi is an expression of such devotion that the listener experiences feelings of extreme closeness and undying love. The listener is bathed in that love and genuinely comes to know what it means to adore.

text: ਹੁਕਮੈ ਬੂਝੈ ਚਉਪੜਿ ਖੇਲੈ ਮਨੁ ਜਿਣਿ ਢਾਲੇ ਪਾਸਾ ॥੩॥
section: Suhi - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: When one understands the Hukam of the Lord's Command, he plays the game of chess with the Lord; throwing the dice, he conquers his own mind. ||3||

transliteration.text: hukamai būjhai chaupar khēlai man jin dhālē pāsā .3.

melody.description: Suhi is an expression of such devotion that the listener experiences feelings of extreme closeness and undying love. The listener is bathed in that love and genuinely comes to know what it means to adore.

text: ਜੋ ਜਨ ਜਾਨਿ ਭਜਹਿ ਅਬਿਗਤ ਕਉ ਤਿਨ ਕਾ ਕਛੂ ਨ ਨਾਸਾ ॥
section: Suhi - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Those humble beings, who know the Imperishable Lord and meditate on Him, are not destroyed at all.

transliteration.text: jō jan jān bhajah abigat kau tin kā kashū n nāsā .

melody.description: Suhi is an expression of such devotion that the listener experiences feelings of extreme closeness and undying love. The listener is bathed in that love and genuinely comes to know what it means to adore.

text: ਕਹੁ ਕਬੀਰ ਤੇ ਜਨ ਕਬਹੁ ਨ ਹਾਰਹਿ ਢਾਲਿ ਜੁ ਜਾਨਹਿ ਪਾਸਾ ॥੪॥੪॥
section: Suhi - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Says Kabeer, those humble beings who know how to throw these dice, never lose the game of life. ||4||4||

transliteration.text: kah kabīr tē jan kabah n hārah dhāl j jānah pāsā .4.4.

melody.description: Suhi is an expression of such devotion that the listener experiences feelings of extreme closeness and undying love. The listener is bathed in that love and genuinely comes to know what it means to adore.
